law.text: If any person loses his certificate or it is destroyed which was earned under KRS 351.120, he shall apply to the commissioner for a duplicate certificate, including with his application an affidavit stating in full how the certificate was destroyed or misplaced. If the commissioner deems it proper he shall furnish the applicant with a duplicate certificate. Any person applying for a duplicate certificate shall pay a fee of five dollars ($5) to the State Treasurer.
law.history: Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 298, sec. 10. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 162, sec. 10, effective March 5, 1952. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2739-45.
